general.text: The books sit in their compartment so snuggly. So neatly. So innocently. You just know they are plotting something…
The exercise bike stands idly. It still looks like new. Probably from lack of use.
This is a ladder and it leads upstairs to a bathroom and to the other modules inside the capsule. What would you like to do?
Where would you like go?
You go to the bathroom.
You do nothing.
This is your
Sleeping Compartment
. Do you want to go to sleep?
You try to sleep but something keeps you from your rest. It is almost like you still have something to do before your day is over.
You decide not to go to sleep. It is really not comfortable up there anyway.
You and Arachne use this fold-out table to play chess and other boardgames sometimes. She usually wins.
This complex hydro-dispenser is able to reconstitute excess liquids into drinkable though tasteless water.You wish there was something else to drink, but at least the water is cold when it comes out.

This chair is probably the worst one ever designed by mortal hands. It's probably why it is up here in space with you. So the rest of humanity would not have to suffer this abominable piece of plastic.
This monitor seems to simply display random waves and charts. You can't tell if they are really monitoring anything and pressing the big buttons has no effect on them. Everything seems normal though.

This machine distributes highly concentrated nutritional supplements that provide the entirety of a day’s recommended intake of vitamins and proteins in a small brown pellet. The machine randomly varies the taste each one has to keep life interesting. Would you like a pellet?
You don't get a pellet.
You get a pellet and eat it. It fills you up quickly. It tastes like oatmeal but it feels really weird eating oatmeal from a pellet.
You get a pellet and eat it. This one tastes like a fancy lobster dinner. Hopefully you won't get an allergic reaction.
The machine refuses to give you a pellet and advises you spend time on the exercise bike.
